attributes.action: Establish Iraqi consulate in Cardiff to improve accessibility for the community
attributes.additional_details: Many Iraqis in Wales and surrounding areas struggle to access consular services due to distance, travel costs, and overcrowding in London. A Cardiff consulate would ease these challenges, improve service availability, and ensure equal access to essential documentation and support.
attributes.background: The Government should work with the Iraqi authorities to set up a consulate in Cardiff, providing essential consular services such as document processing, passport renewals, and legal assistance.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about where to seek to set up Iraqi consulates are a matter for the Iraq Government, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We also can’t accept petitions that request action at a local level.

You could ask your MP to take action on your concerns about this issue, including by asking them to present a public (paper) petition about this.

You can find contact details for your local MP here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP

And you can find out how to ask your MP to present a public (paper) petition here: https://www.parliament.uk/get-involved/sign-a-petition/paper-petitions/
